page.title: 19TOURISM: NATEBY & WHARTON
page.content: LYING BETWEEN THE YORKSHIRE DALES AND THE LAKE DISTRICT, THE TOURIST INDUSTRY IN THIS AREA HAS NOT DEVEL- OPED GREATLY. THIS IS A DISTRICT OF GREAT NATURAL BEAUTY AND LESS SPOILT BY MAN THAN MOST OTHER PARTS OF ENGLAND.GENUINE COUNTRY LOVERS ENJOY FELL WALKING AND THE COAST TO COAST WALK CROSSES THE AREA.THE NUMEROUS FOOTPATHS ARE WELL USED. NO-ONE IN THIS DISTRICT DEPENDS ON TOURISTS FOR THEIR INCCOME.THE BLACK BULL INN AT NATEBY IS THE ONLY EATING PLACE AND 3 PRIVATE HOUSES OFFER BED & BREAK- FAST ACCOMMODATION.THERE ARE NO OFF- ICIAL CARAVAN SITES AND NONE OF THE FARMS HAVE ANY INCOME FROM TOURISM. SUMMER TRAFFIC ON THE ROADS FROM THE DALES WHICH CONVERGE ON NATEBY IS HEAVY BUT MOST PASS THROUGH WITHOUT STOPPING FOR ANY LENGTH OF TIME.
